Getting Started

This guide lists both library and internet resources recommended for finding information in physics and in many cases, includes instructions for using these resources.

  • If you know the name of the service or resource you need, the Quick links column on the left lists University of Maryland (UM) services first, followed by an alphabetical list of the major library and internet resources for physics.
  • If you don't know what resource or service to use, click on the tab at the top of the page to locate that type of information OR use the following chart:
TO FIND: USE:
Definitions of words or phrases   Dictionaries
A detailed work about a broad subject Books
A detailed work about a narrow subject Journal articles
Business information Trade magazine articles
Facts Handbooks
Formulas Handbooks
Manufacturing methods Handbooks
Patents Patents databases
Properties of substances Handbooks
Information about a person Biographies
Organize and format citations EndNote, Zotero
Format a paper or journal article Style manual
Get notices about new articles and books in your area Alerts & RSS feeds

 

Tutorials on basic and advanced library skills are available on the UM Libraries home page under "How Do I...?"> "…learn about doing library research?"> Guides to Information Resources
